text: Kenneth Prewitt (born March 16, 1936) is an American politician and academic. He is the Carnegie Professor of Social Affairs at Columbia University's School of International and Public Affairs. He was also director of the Scholarly Knowledge Project. He was Director of the United States Census Bureau from 1998 to 2001. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official CV at Columbia * Category:1936 births Category:Living people Category:Columbia University faculty Category:Politicians from Illinois Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Kenneth Prewitt
